intro: Epidendrum juninense, commonly known as the Junín Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its sympodial growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically has elongated, leathery leaves that are arranged spirally along the stems. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media. Epidendrum juninense is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
